section.title: Overview
section.para: The Service Extension is a simple wrapper around the service and chkconfig commands. It provides the service change to efficiently control system services with Config5.

section.title: Examples
section.para: Services can be added and removed, enabled and disabled on reboot and started and stopped as shown in the following example spec file:
section.screen: RedHatEnterpriseServer: service add otrs service remove NetworkManager service enable network service disable httpd service start mysqld service stop httpd

section.title: Installation
section.para: This extension is contained in the archive extensions/service.tgz which is part of the Config5 distribution. Simply extract this archive in the deploy directory.

section.title: Settings
section.para: This extension does not have any configurable settings.

section.title: Changes
section.para: This extension provides the service change which can manipulate system services:

Synopsis
service [-ntT] action service
The parameter service specifies the name of the service to manipulate. The parameter action specifies what to do:

listitem.para: Add the service to the list of existing services.
Remove the service from the list of existing services.
Set the service to automatically start when the system starts.
Set the service to remain stopped when the system starts.
Immediately start the service if it is not running already.
Immediately stop the service if it is running.

example.title: Service Manipulation
example.programlisting: sample: service add httpd service enable httpd service start httpd

section.title: Phase
section.para: The service changes are applied in the configure phase.

section.title: Order and Application
section.para: All service changes of a pass are applied in the order the changes are encountered during the parsing of the spec files.
The extension caches service status information. Mixing service and execute changes to manipulate services is not supported.

section.title: Trigger Flag
section.para: The the trigger flag for triggered changes is set when a service is effectively added, removed, enabled, disabled, started or stopped.

section.title: Root Directory
section.para: Changes of this extension are only applied if the root system information item is equal to /.

section.title: System Errors
section.para: System errors are fatal, no changes will be done to the system.

listitem.para: The list of enabled services could not be determined by running chkconfig -L.

section.title: Configuration Data Errors
section.para: Configuration data errors are fatal, no changes will be done to the system.

listitem.para: The action must be add, remove, enable, disable, start or stop.

section.title: Configuration Application Errors
section.para: The following errors are reported for changes as they are applied but do not interrupt the application of other changes.

listitem.para: The named service could not be added, removed, enabled, disabled, started or stopped.
